channel.description: Recent content in üè¢ Johns Hopkins University on HF Daily Paper Reviews by AI

item.title: DINeMo: Learning Neural Mesh Models with no 3D Annotations
item.description: DINeMo: Learns 3D models with no 3D annotations, leveraging pseudo-correspondence from visual foundation models for enhanced pose estimation.

item.title: AgentRxiv: Towards Collaborative Autonomous Research
item.description: AgentRxiv enables collaborative autonomous research via LLM agent preprint sharing, boosting performance and discovery.

item.title: R2-T2: Re-Routing in Test-Time for Multimodal Mixture-of-Experts
item.description: R2-T2: Boost multimodal MoE performance by re-routing experts in test-time, no retraining needed!

item.title: Is That Your Final Answer? Test-Time Scaling Improves Selective Question Answering
Scaling Laws in Patchification: An Image Is Worth 50,176 Tokens And More
item.description: Smaller image patches improve vision transformer performance, defying conventional wisdom and revealing a new scaling law for enhanced visual understanding.

item.title: GenEx: Generating an Explorable World
item.description: GenEx generates explorable 3D worlds from a single image, enabling embodied AI agents to explore and learn.

item.title: Generative World Explorer
item.description: Generative World Explorer (Genex) enables agents to imaginatively explore environments, updating beliefs with generated observations for better decision-making.
